entry.title: 3 SMART Signings To GUARANTEE Liverpool The Title! | üèÜ Sky Mobile Transfer Show

media:group.media:description:
‚ñ∫ Subscribe to Sky Sports Premier League: https://bit.ly/SubscribeSkySportsPL ‚ñ∫ Watch Sky Sports: https://bit.ly/BuySkySports
Hello and welcome back to the Sky Mobile Transfer show where today Dougie Critchley is joined by Laurence McKenna and Nubaid Haroon to make sense of what has been a remarkable transfer window to date for Liverpool.
How will new signings like Florian Wirtz, Hugo Ekitike, Jeremie Frimpong and Milos Kerkez work iN Arne Slot's system? Do our pundits believe Liverpool will be able to sign Newcastle's Alexander Isak? Which other signings should Liverpool target? Could Marc Guehi or Brighton's Jan Paul Van Hecke be the answer to their defensive issues? Could Wolves' Andre offer a positive alternative to Ryan Gravenberch in midfield?
We wrap up the show as usual with our Sky Mobile Switch Of The Week with shouts for Jorrel Hato, Son Heung-Min and Granit Xhaka.
Enjoy the video? Remember to like it, leave a comment and subscribe for more great Premier League content!

Newcastle United have rejected an official bid from Liverpool for Alexander Isak. The offer is believed to be over ¬£100m, but hasn't reached Newcastle's valuation of the player. Newcastle do not want to sell and value Isak at ¬£150m.

entry.title: One Signing To Win Your Club The Title! üèÜ | The Lowdown

media:group.media:description:
‚ñ∫ Subscribe to Sky Sports Premier League: https://bit.ly/SubscribeSkySportsPL ‚ñ∫ Watch Sky Sports: https://bit.ly/BuySkySports
Hello and welcome back to the Lowdown where today Dougie Critchley and Michael McCubbin are joined by Joe Thomlinson to analyse ONE signing to win your side the Premier League title!
Should Liverpool prioritise the signing of Alexander Isak, or would strengthening at centre back with Marc Guehi or central midfield with Lucien Agoum√© serve them better in the long term?
What about Arsenal? Is Eberechi Eze the right way forward or should they instead attempt a SHOCK move for AC Milan's Rafael Leao? Chelsea need a goalkeeper but is Gianluigi Donnarumma, one of the stars of PSG's successful Champions League pursuit the best option or should they instead look to bring in FC Porto's Diogo Costa?
And finally Man City. They need a right back, but is Spurs' Pedro Porro feasible or should they instead go left field and bring in Bayern Munich's Konrad Laimer?
Enjoyed the video? Remember to like it, leave a comment and subscribe to the channel for more great content!
TIMECODES
00:00 Alexander Isak To Liverpool 07:02 Lucien Agoume To Liverpool 14:10 Rafael Leao To Arsenal 17:44 Eberechi Eze To Arsenal 20:38 Is Leao Too Expensive? 24:43 Diogo Costa To Chelsea 29:23 Gianluigi Donnarumma To Chelsea 35:21 Konrad Laimer To Man City 39:50 Pedro Porro To Man City 44:27 Who Will WIN The Premier League?
#football #premierleague #footballpodcast

entry.title: Can Arsenal‚Äôs Signings WIN Them The Premier League?! üèÜ | Sky Mobile Transfer Show

media:group.media:description:
‚ñ∫ Subscribe to Sky Sports Premier League: https://bit.ly/SubscribeSkySportsPL ‚ñ∫ Watch Sky Sports: https://bit.ly/BuySkySports
Welcome back to the Sky Mobile Transfer Show where this week Dougie Critchley is joined by James Allcott and Clive Palmer to discuss all things Arsenal, specifically whether their 6 summer signings to date make them Premier League favourites.
Hear our thoughts on whether Mikel Arteta made the right decision choosing Viktor Gyokeres over Benjamin Sesko? Is Martin Zubimendi the bargain of the summer? Will Noni Madueke defy the doubters after swapping Chelsea for the Emirates? Is Christian Norgaard in fact an upgrade in midfield? And does Cristhian Mosquera have the attributes to succeed at Arsenal?
We also put those signings up against Liverpool's. Do the additions of Florian Wirtz, Jeremie Frimpong, Milos Kerkez and Hugo Ekitike just make Arne Slot's Champions simply too strong? Is there any downside to signing Newcastle's Alexander Isak?
As for the other contenders, is Enzo Maresca's Chelsea team ready for an assault on the title after bringing in the likes of Joao Pedro, Liam Delap, Jamie Gittens, with Xavi Simons and Jorrel Hato potentially to come? Could Rayan Cherki step up and replace the outgoing Kevin De Bruyne's output at Man City?
Enjoy the episode? Remember to like it, leave a comment and subscribe to the channel for more great content!
TIMECODES
00:00 - Viktor Gy√∂keres 05:58 - Mart√≠n Zubimendi 07:43 - Christian N√∏rgaard 09:43 - Noni Madueke 11:39 - Gabriel Martinelli 12:28 - Eberechi Eze 15:34 - Cristhian Mosquera and Squad depth 17:19 - Will Liverpool be as good as they look? 24:15 - Can Liverpool keep everyone happy? 27:11 - Will Manchester City contend? 30:05 - Are Chelsea in the mix? 31:57 - Who will win the league? 33:52 - Switch of the Week
